description:
Kwoniella europaea PYCC6329 is a species of yeast that belongs to the phylum Basidiomycota, class Tremellomycetes, and order Tremellales. It was first isolated from a soil sample collected in Europe.

Kwoniella europaea PYCC6329 is a unicellular, ellipsoid to globose yeast with a diameter of approximately 5-10 micrometers. It reproduces asexually through budding, forming new cells that remain attached to the parent cell. The yeast cells have a smooth cell wall and can grow on a variety of carbon sources, including glucose, sucrose, and maltose.

Phylogenetic analysis based on the sequences of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region and the D1/D2 domain of the large subunit (LSU) rRNA gene has shown that Kwoniella europaea PYCC6329 is closely related to other Kwoniella species, which are commonly found in soil, aquatic environments, and associated with various plant and animal hosts.

This species has potential applications in biotechnology, such as the production of enzymes, bioactive compounds, or as a model organism for studying yeast biology and ecology.
